verbs.description: circumvolve (third-person singular simple present circumvolves, present participle circumvolving, simple past and past participle circumvolved)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To revolve or move around something.
examples: The oracle is now about to beFulfilled by circumvolving destiny;Which says: “Thebes, choose reform or civil war,When through your streets, instead of hare with dogs,A Consort Queen shall hunt a King with Hogs,Riding upon the IONIAN MINOTAUR.”

entries.meaning: (transitive) To roll round; to cause to revolve; to put into a circular motion.
